title: Near Real-Time Transportation Mode Detection Based on Accelerometer Readings

author: Jasna Urbančič, Artificial Intelligence Laboratory, Jožef Stefan Institute

segmentation: Hello, my name is yes, not vantage and I am presenting a joint work with Luca Bradish, can mutation or zhitnik on near real time transportation mode detection based on accelerometer readings.
Our motivation was, well, there exist APIs there that already support fine grained classification of non motorized forms of transportation, such as still walking, running, cycling in vehicle.
However, this is not enough for tracking and routing purposes, specially in use cases for urban environments where.

Public transportation can represent a good alternative to private vehicles, so here are two examples of how routes suggest routes change depending on the transportation mode on the right side there is.
Example for how to get from Jsi to faculty of Computer and Information Science by bus, and on the left side is how to get there by car.

And therefore they are useful in monitoring 3 dimensional.
Device movement, positioning and users activity.
So our data input were accelerometer readings.
We chose accelerometer data over the GPS signal because it uses less power so it preserves battery life.
It is it needs less additional information such as gsy information on trains on train routes and stations.
And also it is more reliable because GPS receivers are typically very shielded during the activities.
Um so.

We measured the acceleration in three physical axes with sampling rate of 100 turds and we collected approximately 20 hours of traveling data with the following distribution in the classification process.
We didn't use the data on we collected when driving a motorbike because there are simply not enough data to do the classification on.
In the first step of preprocessing, we split the recorded signal into smaller pieces.

The other step is gravity estimation, as the readings are correlated with phone's orientation.

That would be a distraction.

Acceleration was greater than zero.
That means that the device was accelerating, and on the examples that acceleration was negative, as this means we were stopping.
And for a classifier we used support vector machine classifier from Q minor.

We did two different classifications, first was binary, one versus all, which means that we used one class as a positive example and the other one is and the other samples were negative examples and we did.
